definition: always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...

sentences.english: He has always been of the opinion that university students ought to have a wider range of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他一向主張大學生的知識面要寬一些。

sentences.english: That drive-in theater always has good movies.
sentences.chinese: 汽車電影院的電影一向不錯。

sentences.english: AgBank's historical relationship with agriculture has been complicated.
sentences.chinese: 農行與農業的歷史關係一向很複雜。

sentences.english: They were a quiet and fond couple.
sentences.chinese: 他們夫婦一向和和睦睦，相親相愛。

sentences.english: The Omani people have all along held profound feelings towards the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 阿曼人民對中國人民一向有着深情厚誼。

sentences.english: Even my always "cool" daddy was almost burst into tears and he gave me a very warm hug.
sentences.chinese: 連一向很“酷”的爸爸也快要哭了，還抱了抱我。

sentences.english: But thou wast ever bravely meek.
sentences.chinese: 但你雖一向溫和卻很勇敢。

sentences.english: China has always been classed as an agricultural country.
sentences.chinese: 中國一向被列爲農業國。

sentences.english: But my problem had always been that I went along with whatever my father wanted.
sentences.chinese: 但這一直都是我的問題，我一向順着父親的意思來。

sentences.english: The water used in making yellow wine is from Jianhu, where water is quality.
sentences.chinese: 釀製紹興黃酒的水一向取於水質特好的鑑湖。

sentences.english: We sll the time require L/C for our exports.
sentences.chinese: 咱們出口一向條件以信用證付款。

sentences.english: Victoria always kept sympathies for the Romanovs in her heart.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞一向同情羅曼諾夫在她心中。

sentences.english: I have long prided myself on being a good teacher.
sentences.chinese: 我一向以身爲一名好老師而自豪。

sentences.english: Government agencies have come under ongoing criticism for not buttoning up their network security.
sentences.chinese: 政府機構一向因忽視網絡安全而倍受批評。

sentences.english: Theyhave federhas air conditionerstuhasly been working on this project since last year.
sentences.chinese: 他們從去年下手一向都在做這個項目。

sentences.english: Always be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 對你的孩子一向要以誠相待。

definition: in the past always/for a long time now/until now
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
complete change from the normal state (idiom); quite uncharacteristic/entirely outside the norm/out of character
to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
only/just (i.e. it is only that...)/all except/unique
